The content focuses on exciting new trends, fashion, and cultural topics across a range of disciplines both in China and abroad. The host presents various culture-related topics in a fun way while also doing some in-depth analysis to give viewers a fuller picture as to what is happening, and why it matters.

programme.title: L'infanzia rubata - I traumi del Terzo Reich
programme.desc: Tre testimoni raccontano la loro infanzia segnata dalla guerra: Günter, soldato bambino; Monika, con un padre disperso; Ruth, ebrea nascosta. Tutti uniti dal trauma causato dal Terzo Reich. A 70 anni dalla fine, le ferite restano visibili.

programme.title: La televisione sotto la svastica
programme.desc: Il documentario svela la nascita della televisione in Germania nazista, antecedente agli anni ’50 americani. Filmati inediti mostrano programmi, eventi e interviste dal Terzo Reich, rivelando una propaganda estetica e ideologica diversa da quella conosciuta, con immagini straordinarie.

programme.title: Desert War - Fighting Rommel
programme.desc: Ancora oggi, Erwin Rommel è considerato un generale apolitico che, con idee geniali, portò gli inglesi sull’orlo della sconfitta in Nord Africa. Ma il suo mito è dovuto soprattutto alla propaganda nazista. Esperti militari analizzano gli eventi.

programme.title: Operazione Barbarossa
programme.desc: L'Operazione Barbarossa si arena a Mosca, ma Hitler rilancia l'offensiva nel 1942 verso il Caucaso e Stalingrado. La Wehrmacht, pur potente, affronta una resistenza sovietica più esperta e una logistica insostenibile. La battaglia di Stalingrado si rivela un disastro per i tedeschi, segnando una svolta psicologica e militare nella guerra.

programme.title: La fine della guerra a Colori
programme.desc: Quando nel marzo 1945 le truppe USA conquistano la Germania nazista da ovest, vengono seguite da troupe che filmano il paese sconfitto e occupato. La particolarità: usano pellicola a colori 16mm. Il risultato è un documento unico, tra città distrutte, volti degli abitanti e orrori del regime.

programme.title: Desert War - Fighting Rommel
programme.desc: Ancora oggi, Erwin Rommel è considerato un generale apolitico che, con idee geniali, portò gli inglesi sull’orlo della sconfitta in Nord Africa. Ma il suo mito è dovuto soprattutto alla propaganda nazista. Esperti militari analizzano gli eventi.

programme.title: Eva Braun
programme.desc: Solo dopo la sua morte Eva Braun entrò nell’occhio pubblico in Germania. Il 30 aprile 1945 si tolse la vita con Hitler nel bunker a Berlino, un giorno dopo averlo sposato. A lungo tenuta ai margini, visse tra Monaco e il Berghof. Una biografia recente prova a superare l’immagine della bionda passiva.

programme.title: Morte nel Bunker - La vera storia della caduta di Hitler
programme.desc: Hitler, fisicamente e mentalmente instabile, si suicidò (cianuro e pistola). Magda Goebbels uccise i figli, forse con un medico.

programme.title: Il Terzo Reich a colori
programme.desc: Archivi privati rivelano inediti filmati a colori del Terzo Reich: Normandia, feste, atrocità della Wehrmacht e vita di Hitler, offrendo un'opprimente realtà del regime nazista.

programme.title: La fine della guerra a Colori
programme.desc: Quando nel marzo 1945 le truppe USA conquistano la Germania nazista da ovest, vengono seguite da troupe che filmano il paese sconfitto e occupato. La particolarità: usano pellicola a colori 16mm. Il risultato è un documento unico, tra città distrutte, volti degli abitanti e orrori del regime.

programme.title: Hitler e la sua cerchia ristretta
programme.desc: Per decenni gli storici hanno sostenuto che Hitler non avesse vita privata e fosse un essere socialmente disturbato. In uno studio innovativo, Heike Görtemaker ha rivelato che aveva relazioni e amicizie. Il suo circolo ristretto era il suo rifugio, basato su lealtà assoluta fino alla fine nel 1945.

programme.title: Operazione Barbarossa
programme.desc: L'Operazione Barbarossa (1941) fu l'invasione nazista dell'URSS, un'aggressione brutale. Nonostante i successi iniziali, la Wehrmacht sottovalutò la resistenza sovietica e l'immensità del territorio. Il conflitto, segnato da atrocità e ordini criminali, divenne una guerra di annientamento, fallendo nella conquista di Mosca.

programme.title: The Blitzkrieg Myth
programme.desc: Blitzkrieg: successi tedeschi iniziali, non pianificati, guidati dalla follia di Hitler.

programme.title: La fine della guerra a Colori
programme.desc: Quando nel marzo 1945 le truppe USA conquistano la Germania nazista da ovest, vengono seguite da troupe che filmano il paese sconfitto e occupato. La particolarità: usano pellicola a colori 16mm. Il risultato è un documento unico, tra città distrutte, volti degli abitanti e orrori del regime.

programme.title: The Blitzkrieg Myth
programme.desc: Blitzkrieg: successi tedeschi iniziali, non pianificati, guidati dalla follia di Hitler.

programme.title: La fine della guerra a Colori
programme.desc: Quando nel marzo 1945 le truppe USA conquistano la Germania nazista da ovest, vengono seguite da troupe che filmano il paese sconfitto e occupato. La particolarità: usano pellicola a colori 16mm. Il risultato è un documento unico, tra città distrutte, volti degli abitanti e orrori del regime.

programme.title: Il Terzo Reich a Colori
programme.desc: Archivi privati rivelano inediti filmati a colori del Terzo Reich: Normandia, feste, atrocità della Wehrmacht e vita di Hitler, offrendo un'opprimente realtà del regime nazista.

programme.title: Desert War - Fighting Rommel
programme.desc: Ancora oggi, Erwin Rommel è considerato un generale apolitico che, con idee geniali, portò gli inglesi sull’orlo della sconfitta in Nord Africa. Ma il suo mito è dovuto soprattutto alla propaganda nazista. Esperti militari analizzano gli eventi.

programme.title: Eva Braun
programme.desc: Solo dopo la sua morte Eva Braun entrò nell’occhio pubblico in Germania. Il 30 aprile 1945 si tolse la vita con Hitler nel bunker a Berlino, un giorno dopo averlo sposato. A lungo tenuta ai margini, visse tra Monaco e il Berghof. Una biografia recente prova a superare l’immagine della bionda passiva.

programme.title: La Conferenza di Wannsee
programme.desc: L’incontro durò poco meno di 90 minuti nelle stanze arredate con gusto della Villa di Wannsee. Adolf Eichmann descrisse in seguito l’atmosfera come rilassata e allegra. L’argomento era la “Soluzione finale della questione ebraica”. Si trattava dell’espulsione sistematica e dello sterminio di circa undici milioni di persone.

programme.title: L'assedio di Leningrado
programme.desc: L’assedio di Leningrado durò 872 giorni, dal 1941 al 1944. La città era circondata e gli abitanti affrontarono fame estrema, disperazione e casi drammatici di cannibalismo. Storie strazianti raccontano la lotta per sopravvivere in condizioni disumane.

programme.title: The Blitzkrieg Myth
programme.desc: Blitzkrieg: successi tedeschi iniziali, non pianificati, guidati dalla follia di Hitler.

programme.title: L'infanzia rubata - I traumi del Terzo Reich
programme.desc: Tre testimoni raccontano la loro infanzia segnata dalla guerra: Günter, soldato bambino; Monika, con un padre disperso; Ruth, ebrea nascosta. Tutti uniti dal trauma causato dal Terzo Reich. A 70 anni dalla fine, le ferite restano visibili.

programme.title: La fine della guerra a Colori
programme.desc: Quando nel marzo 1945 le truppe USA conquistano la Germania nazista da ovest, vengono seguite da troupe che filmano il paese sconfitto e occupato. La particolarità: usano pellicola a colori 16mm. Il risultato è un documento unico, tra città distrutte, volti degli abitanti e orrori del regime.

programme.title: Hitler e la sua cerchia ristretta
programme.desc: Per decenni gli storici hanno sostenuto che Hitler non avesse vita privata e fosse un essere socialmente disturbato. In uno studio innovativo, Heike Görtemaker ha rivelato che aveva relazioni e amicizie. Il suo circolo ristretto era il suo rifugio, basato su lealtà assoluta fino alla fine nel 1945.

programme.title: The Blitzkrieg Myth
programme.desc: Blitzkrieg: successi tedeschi iniziali, non pianificati, guidati dalla follia di Hitler.

programme.title: Il Terzo Reich a colori
programme.desc: Archivi privati rivelano inediti filmati a colori del Terzo Reich: Normandia, feste, atrocità della Wehrmacht e vita di Hitler, offrendo un'opprimente realtà del regime nazista.

programme.title: La televisione sotto la svastica
programme.desc: Il documentario svela la nascita della televisione in Germania nazista, antecedente agli anni ’50 americani. Filmati inediti mostrano programmi, eventi e interviste dal Terzo Reich, rivelando una propaganda estetica e ideologica diversa da quella conosciuta, con immagini straordinarie.

programme.title: 1945 - La guerra in prima linea in Germania
programme.desc: Quando le truppe americane iniziarono la loro invasione finale della Germania nazista a metà febbraio del 1945, i cineoperatori dell’esercito statunitense erano al loro fianco. Ripresero molte ore di straordinario materiale su pellicola da 35 mm. Più di mille rulli sono stati conservati negli archivi americani; molti di essi non sono stati toccati per decenni. Mostrano per la Seconda Guerra Mondiale ciò che abbiamo visto finora solo per le guerre in Vietnam e, più recentemente, in Iraq. Integrati nelle truppe, i cineoperatori documentarono numerose storie di vittoria e sconfitta, morte e liberazione. Volti di disperazione e gioia, scene di guerra e di pace, filmate con meticolosità da...

programme.desc: Berlino distrutta dopo la guerra. Giovani disorientati, criminalità (Gladow). Divisione Est/Ovest, mercato nero. Ricerca di un nuovo inizio.

programme.title: Leni Riefenstahl - La fine di un mito
programme.desc: Leni Riefenstahl, regista di Hitler, divide ancora. Genio o propagandista? Il documentario svela il suo uso spregiudicato di collaboratori e la sua negazione dei crimini nazisti, rivelando una carriera controversa.

programme.title: Pixel Collage
programme.desc: A well-crafted collage of selected short documentaries telling stories about all aspects of China! People, technology, culture, and wildlife, all are showcased in Internet-friendly form.

programme.title: Today’s Top Pick
programme.desc: Documentaries in this slot are rebroadcasts of our most-viewed and most popular stories of the season. They feature important social, economic, environmental or other policy-driven issues, affecting lives nationwide or simply in one small village. A broad selection of top productions by Chinese top documentary producers.

programme.title: Humanities and Geography
programme.desc: A strand devoted to the nature and wildlife of China, the people who lived alongside them, and the great and diverse landscapes with which they all contend.

programme.title: Living China
programme.desc: Real life stories told from the personal perspective. Moving, dramatic, sorrows and joys, expressed emphatically and expressed quietly. Watch closely to see and understand the real China as it is lived.

programme.title: Special Edition
programme.desc: Prestige Chinese documentary production, tackling serious subjects with the best cinematography, editing, and all round production values with a unique Chinese perspective.

programme.title: Journeys and Discoveries
programme.desc: A documentary series showcasing the history of China and its people.

programme.title: History in the Frame
programme.desc: A documentary series featuring historical and archaeological exploration.

programme.title: Best Eats
programme.desc: Food connects people! A feast for the eyes that spotlights the cuisines of China in a way that’s bound to set the mouths of the whole globe watering!

programme.title: Youthful China
programme.desc: The youth of a country is the future of that country. A series of documentaries focusing on the younger generation of China in which you get to see what they are achieving and what makes them tick!

programme.title: Dropped - S02:E07 - Valley of Snow
programme.desc: The Keefer brothers are stuck at Church Camp as the snow keeps pounding down, and they can barely see anything. They're snowed in and don't know when they'll be able to continue their hunting trip. They're starting to face a bunch of problems.

programme.title: Miracles of Nature - S01:E08 - Naturally Raw
programme.desc: This episode begins in Costa Rica, in an amazing rain forest. Here they make delicious chocolate out of cocoa beans. Mother Nature is at her magnificent best – showcasing hundreds of plant and animal species. And then to Kenya where green monkeys will be our tour-guides in the Lost City of Gedi plus a closer look at the wildlife which lives in very close proximity to the bustling streets of Nairobi.

programme.title: Miracles of Nature - S01:E09 - Naturally Invigorating
programme.desc: Iceland: home to volcanic lakes and hot springs and mono-chromatic vistas. And then to Laos in South East Asia with its lush jungles, underground caves and water buffalo along the Mekong River.

programme.title: The Luxury Travel Show - S01:E11 - The Loire and Grenada
programme.desc: There’s more to the Loire Valley in France than wine. We’re on the Da Vinci trail, following in the last footsteps and final resting place of the great Leonardo da Vinci in the small town of Amboise, deep in the heart of the Loire. Then for the ultimate in relaxation it’s a pamper and spa break in Grenada.

programme.title: Royal Documentaries - S01:E34 - Prince William And Prince Harry The Next Royal Generation
programme.desc: Prince William and Prince Harry, along with their friends, got as much media attention as today’s pop stars, fashion icons, and movie celebs. This documentary explores how this affected their personal lives and friendships, showcasing how they managed their fame alongside their royal responsibilities.

programme.title: Carter's W.A.R. - S02:E05 - Capturing the Wild
programme.desc: After seeing the disappearance of wildlife in northern Africa, Ivan joins an elite capture team to see how wildlife is captured, bought, and sold. This 'Wildlife Trade' is a ground breaking business model that could change the entire face of conservation in Africa.

programme.title: Wild Ones - S01:E09 - Disguised
programme.desc: Now you see me… now you don’t. A look at the masters of disguise. From hidden lizards and invisible spiders to camouflaged cats and shimmering squids.

programme.title: Wild Ones - S01:E10 - Micro Predators
programme.desc: They may be small but don’t be fooled - micro predators can be deadly. From the impressive serial killer Portia spider to the hundreds of species of ants and the archerfish with its precision firing of water droplets to secure its prey Wild Ones peers through the microscope to uncover their true lethality.

programme.title: Wild Ones - S01:E11 - Most Poisonous_
programme.desc: You wouldn’t want to be bitten by any of these but which one has the deadliest poison? The venom from the most poisonous snake on the planet? A rare poisonous lizard? Or is it the blue ringed octopus?

programme.title: Wild Ones - S01:E12 - Migration
programme.desc: Animals, big and not so big, traverse hundreds of miles – some in search of food, others to find ideal breeding grounds. From Zebras crossing the savannahs of Africa to the huge journeys undertaken by turtles to find the perfect beach to lay their eggs – the annual and often dangerous journeys are simply mind boggling.

programme.title: Miracles of Nature - S02:E06 - Naturally Miraculous
programme.desc: In the rain forests of the Seychelles we encounter remarkable fauna and flora. Then on to Mauritius. Where the symbol of the cruel and inconsiderate colonization of Africa is the extinct Dodo bird. We conclude today’s episode in the very heart of Africa, in the only place on the planet where close relatives to humans, the mountain gorillas - live. The country is the Democratic Republic of Congo and the province we shall visit is South Kivu.

programme.title: Miracles of Nature - S02:E07 - Naturally Fascinating
programme.desc: Bolivia is a country of countless fascinating natural sights. We will begin on the high plateau of Altiplano, stopping by the world’s largest salt lake.Later, we will descend a few thousand meters using the road of death to the Los Yungas province. And then on to the shores of lake Titicaca, the highest navigable lake in the world.

programme.title: Miracles of Nature - S02:E08 - Naturally Harmonious
programme.desc: Zambia, the Latvian region of Kurzeme, the Georgian provinces of Kakheti and Svaneti, seem to have very little in common. They lie in Africa, Europe and on the borderline between Europe and Asia respectively. Kakheti and Svaneti are both a part of Georgia but very unlike one another. So where is the connection? How are these regions similar?

programme.title: Miracles of Nature - S02:E09 - Naturally Spiritual
programme.desc: In this episode we visit two different corners of our planet. Although thousands of kilometres apart, spiritually they are close relatives. First, Ethiopia in East Africa which is dissected by the Great African Rift Valley and considered by many to be the cradle of humankind. Next, a paradise on Earth: Jamaica.

programme.title: Sasquatch Mountain Man - S05:E01 - Mule Deer
programme.desc: Laramy rides the high lonesome in search of a mountain mule deer. Learn the old mountain man techniques to stalk in close to a big mule deer buck.

programme.title: Sasquatch Mountain Man - S05:E02 - Alaska Caribou Part 1
programme.desc: Deep in the Alaskan territory, Laramy hunts the frontier in search of caribou. When a hungry grizzly sniffs around camp, will Laramy's single shot rifle be enough protection?

programme.title: Sasquatch Mountain Man - S05:E03 - Montana Mountain Lion
programme.desc: Laramy lets loose the dogs and rides the snowy mountains in search of the big game cat of North America, the mountain lion.

programme.title: Sasquatch Mountain Man - S05:E04 - Trapping Part 1
programme.desc: Springtime begins as Laramy honors the history of the mountain men by trapping for beaver and other critters.

programme.title: Carter's W.A.R. - S02:E05 - Capturing the Wild
programme.desc: After seeing the disappearance of wildlife in northern Africa, Ivan joins an elite capture team to see how wildlife is captured, bought, and sold. This 'Wildlife Trade' is a ground breaking business model that could change the entire face of conservation in Africa.

programme.title: Royal Documentaries - S01:E35 - Prince Charles At 50 Heir To Sadness
programme.desc: After Diana's death, everyone's attention turned to Charles, who was not only a widower and a dad but also next in line for the throne. This show takes a closer look at how he got along with his sons, his longtime love Camilla, and what his future might look like as King. Royal experts David Starkey and Anthony Holden share their insights.

programme.title: Wardens - S02:E06 - Operation Bitterroot
programme.desc: Montana's Game Wardens have their hands full on the first day of big game season. Tag along as they check out the Bitterroot game area. And to nab poachers, they've got a clever sting operation going, using a mobile decoy.

programme.title: Dropped - S02:E08 - End of the Line
programme.desc: While Chris hears the bull getting closer, he can't spot it. Casey, however, has a clear view. They attempt to communicate with hand signals, but the bull vanishes over the mountain, out of sight.

programme.title: Miracles of Nature - S01:E10 - Naturally Potent
programme.desc: Explore the unspoilt mountains of Lapland and on to the pristine Swiss Alps. In contrast we then travel to Champagne Province in France - home of the finest wines in the world. Finally, Gibraltar beckons with its long history and strange mysterious caves.

programme.title: Miracles of Nature - S01:E11 - Naturally Different
programme.desc: The Shetland Islands: home to 20,000 humans, one million birds and the smallest horse in the world. Then on to an area known to the locals as the Centre of the World in South Eastern province of Kazakhstan. From there we will go to the Yellow Mountains in Central China often called The Venice of China.

programme.title: The Luxury Travel Show - S01:E13 - Barbados and Lake Como
programme.desc: Barbados has it all. Home to The Cliff, one of the world’s most famous restaurants where sharks swim in the floodlit bay and entertain diners. Considered by many to be the best of the Caribbean Islands it is home to media moguls and pop princesses alike. Italy’s Lake Como also plays host to a number of famous Hollywood stars and directors who’ve fallen in love with its breath-taking vistas and fabulous cuisine.

programme.title: The Luxury Travel Show - S01:E01 - Chiang Mai and Eze
programme.desc: Nestled in the foothills of northern Thailand, Chiang Mai is the country’s fifth largest city. Brimming with culture, beautiful architecture and stunning temples it’s often considered a sanctuary away from Bangkok. In the South of France, nestled between Nice and Monte Carlo is the picture postcard town of Eze.

programme.title: Jim Shockey's Uncharted - S01:E12 - The Last Hunters
programme.desc: Arctic Pt3. The Inuit take Jim and Corey on their last adventure together. Jim finds inspiration from empty stretches of broken ice and the people who live off it.

programme.title: Harry & Meghan: A Very Modern Romance
programme.desc: Meghan Markle and Prince Harry share similar interests and seem like a perfect match. Both have faced tough times growing up but have come out on top. Now they're winning together. This hour-long special, featuring a chat with author Andrew Morton, explores the social backdrop that makes their bold marriage fit right in with today's British Royal Family.

programme.title: Royal Documentaries - S01:E35 - Prince Charles At 50 Heir To Sadness
programme.desc: After Diana's death, everyone's attention turned to Charles, who was not only a widower and a dad but also next in line for the throne. This show takes a closer look at how he got along with his sons, his longtime love Camilla, and what his future might look like as King. Royal experts David Starkey and Anthony Holden share their insights.

Considered by many to be the best of the Caribbean Islands it is home to media moguls and pop princesses alike. Italy’s Lake Como also plays host to a number of famous Hollywood stars and directors who’ve fallen in love with its breath-taking vistas and fabulous cuisine.

programme.title: The Luxury Travel Show - S01:E01 - Chiang Mai and Eze
programme.desc: Nestled in the foothills of northern Thailand, Chiang Mai is the country’s fifth largest city. Brimming with culture, beautiful architecture and stunning temples it’s often considered a sanctuary away from Bangkok. In the South of France, nestled between Nice and Monte Carlo is the picture postcard town of Eze.

programme.title: Jim Shockey's Uncharted - S01:E12 - The Last Hunters
programme.desc: Arctic Pt3. The Inuit take Jim and Corey on their last adventure together. Jim finds inspiration from empty stretches of broken ice and the people who live off it.

programme.title: Harry & Meghan: A Very Modern Romance
programme.desc: Meghan Markle and Prince Harry share similar interests and seem like a perfect match. Both have faced tough times growing up but have come out on top. Now they're winning together. This hour-long special, featuring a chat with author Andrew Morton, explores the social backdrop that makes their bold marriage fit right in with today's British Royal Family.

programme.title: Royal Documentaries - S01:E35 - Prince Charles At 50 Heir To Sadness
programme.desc: After Diana's death, everyone's attention turned to Charles, who was not only a widower and a dad but also next in line for the throne. This show takes a closer look at how he got along with his sons, his longtime love Camilla, and what his future might look like as King. Royal experts David Starkey and Anthony Holden share their insights.

programme.title: Wardens - S02:E06 - Operation Bitterroot
programme.desc: Montana's Game Wardens have their hands full on the first day of big game season. Tag along as they check out the Bitterroot game area. And to nab poachers, they've got a clever sting operation going, using a mobile decoy.

programme.title: Dropped - S02:E08 - End of the Line
programme.desc: While Chris hears the bull getting closer, he can't spot it. Casey, however, has a clear view. They attempt to communicate with hand signals, but the bull vanishes over the mountain, out of sight.

programme.title: Miracles of Nature - S01:E10 - Naturally Potent
programme.desc: Explore the unspoilt mountains of Lapland and on to the pristine Swiss Alps. In contrast we then travel to Champagne Province in France - home of the finest wines in the world. Finally, Gibraltar beckons with its long history and strange mysterious caves.

programme.title: Miracles of Nature - S01:E11 - Naturally Different
programme.desc: The Shetland Islands: home to 20,000 humans, one million birds and the smallest horse in the world. Then on to an area known to the locals as the Centre of the World in South Eastern province of Kazakhstan. From there we will go to the Yellow Mountains in Central China often called The Venice of China.

programme.title: The Luxury Travel Show - S01:E13 - Barbados and Lake Como
programme.desc: Barbados has it all. Home to The Cliff, one of the world’s most famous restaurants where sharks swim in the floodlit bay and entertain diners. Considered by many to be the best of the Caribbean Islands it is home to media moguls and pop princesses alike. programme.title: Storm Hunters
programme.desc: Destructive tornadoes and ferocious winds are only two elements Mark and Jaclyn encounter when storm hunting.

programme.title: Storm Hunters
programme.desc: A white monster charges up the Eastern Seaboard, and 80 million citizens are in its path.

programme.title: Hellfire Heroes
programme.desc: Trouble during a training session; a rollover traps 4 people and ejects 2 others into a swift-moving river.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Nel 1995, la cameriera di Palm Beach Denise O'Neill venne rapita e uccisa. Il suo vicino Luis Caballero destò sospetti per il suo strano comportamento nei confronti delle troupe televisive che riprendevano il crimine.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Detectives search for the bombers of two churches in Illinois, hoping that the materials used in the remnants of the handmade bombs will offer the clues to catch the culprits.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Nel 1999, Susan Fassett fu freddata mentre lasciava le prove del coro della chiesa a Poughkeepsie, New York. Il marito Jeff diventò il primo sospettato finché non lo scagionò la polizia, che sospettava di Fred Andros, con cui Susan aveva una storia.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Nel 2008, l'universitaria Jenna Verhaalen fu trovata morta nel suo appartamento a Bryan, in Texas, e le emorragie petecchiali nei suoi occhi indicavano che era stata strangolata.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Nel 2006, Darlene VanderGiesen ricevette e-mail minacciose e poi scomparve. Il monitoraggio della fonte delle e-mail portò la polizia a casa di Daphne Wright, dove credono sia stato commesso un omicidio.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Nel 2000, Ken, il marito di Kristine Fitzhugh, la trovò morta in fondo alle scale della loro casa a Palo Alto.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Dopo che il sospetto fu accusato di incendio doloso e delitto, sostenne la sua innocenza ma fu condannato a 25 anni di galera. Ricorse a testi legali nella biblioteca del carcere e a programmi di scienza forense e decise di provare la sua innocenza.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Nel 2008, l'immobiliarista del Colorado Alan Helmick fu trovato colpito a morte a casa della moglie Miriam, che diventò quindi la principale sospettata.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Nel 2004, Rebecca Barney e il suo futuro ex marito Fred furono trovati colpiti a morte nella loro casa di Tulsa, in Oklahoma, che era stata data alle fiamme.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Nel 2000, Christina Sanoubane venne uccisa nel suo appartamento dopo che si allontanò dal fidanzato violento.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Nel 2004, la studentessa di infermieristica Tamika Huston sparì dalla sua casa a Spartanburg, Sud Carolina. Una soffiata portò gli investigatori alla sua macchina e trovarono chiavi di casa ignote che avrebbero potuto aiutare a risolvere il caso.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Uno stupratore seriale era a piede libero in una città in Texas. Nessuno sapeva dove avrebbe colpito ancora.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Una giovane donna frequenta le funzioni religiose serali... poi scompare. Quando la sua auto abbandonata viene ritrovata, il serbatoio è vuoto e manca una tanica di benzina che teneva nel bagagliaio per le emergenze.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Nel 2003, Tiffany Rowell e tre dei suoi amici furono brutalmente assassinati nel loro ricco quartiere di Clear Lake, in Texas, e la scena del crimine fornì poche prove.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Nel 1991, Dorothy Donovan fu assassinata nella sua casa a Dover, Delaware e la polizia era scettica quando suo figlio Charles Holden dichiarò che era stata uccisa da un autostoppista a cui lui aveva dato un passaggio.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: La polizia ricava un indizio su una coppia scomparsa nel weekend del Memorial Day durante una rapina in corso. Le prove trovate risolvono un crimine brutale.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Nel 1986, Gary Dale Larson fu pugnalato a morte nella sua casa a Edmond, in Oklahoma, e poi l'assassino violentò la fidanzata di Larson, Janet Haynes.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In un tragico scherzo del destino, pochi giorni dopo che la donna vendette casa e si traslocò in un umile caravan, un incendio le tolse sia il caravan che la vita. Ma l'autopsia dimostrò che non fu un incidente.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Due sospetti che convivono sono stati collegati a un omicidio per stivali macchiati di sangue e una pistola.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Nel 1984, il corpo dell'universitaria Laura Salmon fu trovato in una fattoria del Middle Tennessee, coperto dai suoi jeans e dai jeans dell'assassino.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Rachael Mullenix, 19enne, fu condannata per aver pugnalato la madre, Barbara Mullenix, il 13 settembre 2006, e poi aver imballato il suo cadavere insanguinato in una scatola di cartone prima di scaricarlo a Newport Bay, sulla costa della California.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Una vacanza in famiglia si trasforma in un incubo quando la moglie viene rinvenuta a faccia in giù nel lago.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Nel 2008, l'universitaria Jenna Verhaalen fu trovata morta nel suo appartamento a Bryan, in Texas, e le emorragie petecchiali nei suoi occhi indicavano che era stata strangolata.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: La donna venne violentata, pugnalata più volte e lasciata morire. Quando qualcuno che coincideva con la descrizione si è praticamente costituito, la polizia era sicura di avere il suo uomo... finché le prove del DNA non hanno dimostrato il contrario.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Nel 2007, Shamaia Smith scomparve dallo strip club in cui lavorava a East Hartford, CT. La polizia indagò su vari clienti dello strip club, ma si concentrò sull'uomo d'affari locale Kenneth Otto.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Quando due donne scomparvero e in seguito furono ritrovate brutalmente assassinate, la polizia si chiese se fossero vittime di un crimine d'odio.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Nel 2007, Brian e Beverly Mauck furono trovati morti nella loro casa a Graham, Washington. Con un'impronta palmare insanguinata e impronte di scarpe, gli inquirenti si focalizzarono su Daniel Tavares, che in passato aveva tatuato la schiena a Brian.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Detectives search for the bombers of two churches in Illinois, hoping that the materials used in the remnants of the handmade bombs will offer the clues to catch the culprits.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Un chirurgo viene colpito a morte e il sospettato principale viene visto al ristorante al momento del delitto.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Una donna fu brutalmente uccisa nella sua casa e gli unici testimoni del delitto erano i cani di famiglia. Un esperto di comportamento canino era certo che il killer conoscesse sia la vittima che gli animali e deciso a capire cosa videro i cani.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Nel 2008, l'immobiliarista del Colorado Alan Helmick fu trovato colpito a morte a casa della moglie Miriam, che diventò quindi la principale sospettata.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Avis Banks e il suo nascituro furono brutalmente uccisi. Il corpo venne scoperto dal fidanzato Keyon Pittman.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Nel 1996, Gayle Isleib, 54 anni, subì un agguato nel vialetto a Manchester, Connecticut, e fu colpita a morte.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Quando una studentessa universitaria risulta scomparsa, la polizia crede che l'indagine sarà come tante altre. Ma quando scoprono schizzi di sangue nella camera da letto del suo ragazzo, capiscono che questo caso sarà diverso.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Fu uno dei casi più insoliti nella storia forense. Gli investigatori dovevano trovare un modo per risolvere un caso di omicidio con prove composte da un pomodoro schiacciato trovato sul luogo del delitto e piccoli riflessi di luce in una foto.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: La vittima venne pugnalata più di cento volte, lasciando la sua camera da letto intrisa di sangue. Anche se il suo corpo era posizionato in modo suggestivo, non era stata violentata. È stato un crimine sessuale o è stato un atto di violenza casuale?

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Si sospetta un omicidio quando l'operaia di Fort Worth Glenda Furch scompare nel settembre 2007 dopo aver terminato il suo turno.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Quando una giovane ragazza venne trovata morta, la polizia arrestò subito il sospetto più probabile. Ma la tecnologia all'avanguardia della NASA permise a un odontoiatra forense di dimostrare che dietro le sbarre vi era l'uomo sbagliato.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Una studentessa dell'ultimo anno è stata trovata violentata e uccisa vicino a un sentiero sterrato usato dagli studenti per camminare da un lato all'altro del campus.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Nel 2000, Judy Southern tornò a casa dal lavoro e fu colpita da un uomo armato che aspettava all'interno.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Il miglioramento digitale del video di sicurezza rivela che ciò che sembra un incontro casuale è in realtà un sequestro che porta all'omicidio. Gli inquirenti sospettano che i crimini non siano casuali e temono che vi sia un serial killer in libertà.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Quanto può essere sfortunato un uomo? Sua moglie si è tolta la vita e la sua fidanzata del college si uccise allo stesso modo quattordici anni prima. Gli investigatori dovevano stabilire se si trattasse solo di una strana coincidenza o di un delitto.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Nel 2006, Darlene VanderGiesen ricevette e-mail minacciose e poi scomparve. Il monitoraggio della fonte delle e-mail portò la polizia a casa di Daphne Wright, dove credono sia stato commesso un omicidio.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: La vittima era un self-made man che non ha mai usato mezzi termini. Forse è stato assassinato da un cliente o da un dipendente insoddisfatto. Forse le foto audaci nella sua cassaforte contenevano l'indizio per risolvere il crimine.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Nel 2006, la politica del Nevada Kathy Augustine morì misteriosamente in un'accanita campagna di rielezione e il medico legale non riuscì né ad individuare la causa di morte né a spiegare le piccole ferite da puntura scoperte durante l'autopsia.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Tracey Frame, 35 anni, venne condannata per l'omicidio di David Nixon nell'aprile 2002 dopo che aveva pianificato di porre fine alla loro relazione.

programme.desc: Una giovane donna viene uccisa, ma il suo ragazzo sfugge a un attacco raccapricciante. Dopo quasi 50 anni senza un arresto, un nuovo test forense rivela un uomo con un segreto oscuro.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Anche se la loro figlia era già scappata, tornava sempre. I suoi genitori erano sicuri che questa volta non sarebbe stato diverso, ma si sbagliavano.

programme.title: 100 Rock Ballads with Simon Bates
programme.desc: 9 hours of love, heartbreak, loss & personal struggle. Who better than Mr Our Tune Simon Bates with another rock marathon spanning 5 decades.

programme.title: High School Rock Out: 1995-2005
programme.desc: We open the high school year book with Weezer in 1995 and remember the amazing bands that rocked every school party through to 2005!

programme.title: Stuff The Turkey! 50 Bangers
programme.desc: A Christmas feast of classic rock bangers & anthems! Starting with the Stones & Jimi Hendrix through to Green Day, the Foo Fighters all with a few christmas crakers thrown in!

programme.title: Rock 'n' Roll Top 3s: 1990-1999
programme.desc: A 2 hour run through, in order, of top 3 hits from the 90s - all with that rock n roll swagger! Expect plenty of U2, Def Leppard, Meat Loaf & Brit Pop!.

programme.title: Rated Rock! The No.1s
programme.desc: Number 1 rock songs from the last 50 years! With mega hits from the Arctic Monkeys & KOL right back to legends like The Stones & T.Rex!

programme.title: Nicky Horne's 30 Hardest Hitters!
programme.desc: The 30 greatest rock drummers in the world! These are Nicky's hardest hitters featuring Dave Grohl, Tommy Lee, Keith Moon, Ginger Baker, John Bonham but who is his Number 1?

programme.title: All Killer: 00s Rock Bands!
programme.desc: 25 of the greatest rock bands of the noughties featuring Paramore, Bullet For My Valentine, Slipknot and My Chemical Romance.

programme.title: Rated Rock! The No.1s
programme.desc: Number 1 rock songs from the last 50 years! With mega hits from the Arctic Monkeys & KOL right back to legends like The Stones & T.Rex!

programme.title: No Intro Needed: 50 Rock Classics
programme.desc: 50 legendary rock tracks you absolutely know - but how fast can you name them? One thing's for sure: after the first riff, they'll be stuck in your head all night long!

programme.title: Party Rock Anthems!
programme.desc: Party pop rock anthems spanning 5 decades! From Queen, Kiss & Aerosmith to Blur, Paramore & The White Stripes.

programme.title: Electric Elves: Christmas Encore!
programme.desc: These are the rock Christmas classics that keep the elves busy in the workshop! Expect electric festive anthems from Quo to The Darkness and Bon Jovi to Wizzard.

programme.title: Legendary Rock: 1980-1989
programme.desc: These are the legendary rock stars that made the 80s! Expect Meat Loaf, Bonnie Tyler, Queen, Bon Jovi, AC/DC, Iron Maiden & loads more!

programme.title: Rock 'n' Roll Top 3s: 1990-1999
programme.desc: A 2 hour run through, in order, of top 3 hits from the 90s - all with that rock n roll swagger! Expect plenty of U2, Def Leppard, Meat Loaf & Brit Pop!.

programme.title: Rated Rock! The No.1s
programme.desc: Number 1 rock songs from the last 50 years! With mega hits from the Arctic Monkeys & KOL right back to legends like The Stones & T.Rex!

programme.title: Nicky Horne's 30 Hardest Hitters!
programme.desc: The 30 greatest rock drummers in the world! These are Nicky's hardest hitters featuring Dave Grohl, Tommy Lee, Keith Moon, Ginger Baker, John Bonham but who is his Number 1?

programme.title: All Killer: 00s Rock Bands!
programme.desc: 25 of the greatest rock bands of the noughties featuring Paramore, Bullet For My Valentine, Slipknot and My Chemical Romance.

programme.title: Rock Number 1s! 1970-1979
programme.desc: An hour of rockin' chart toppers through the 70s with hits from Jimi Hendrix, Alice Cooper, Suzi Quatro and Queen.

programme.title: Soft Rock Anthems 1980-2015
programme.desc: 35 years of timeless, soft rock tracks & big power ballads form 1980 to 2015!

programme.title: Carol's Carols! A Rockin Good Xmas
programme.desc: T'Pau's "Carols" Decker with 50 years of rockin' seasonal classics - a festive selection box that will leave you wishing it really WAS Christmas every day!

programme.title: Foo Fighters: Fan Favourites
programme.desc: From 1995 to 2011 - 45 minutes of the biggest rock songs from The Foo Fighters!

programme.title: Maxed Out On 2005 Anthems!
programme.desc: Live it loud and Max out on the finest rock anthems! Featuring The Arctic Monkeys, Nickleback, Green Day & The Strokes. This is Now Rock!

programme.title: 90s Rock: From Grunge to Alt
programme.desc: A 90s evolution of Rock: From the raw energy of glam and the grunge to the alt rock revolution. Expect to see Def Leppard, Guns N Roses, Alanis, No Doubt and many more!

programme.title: Killer Cuts Of The 00s!
programme.desc: A decade of mega hits and the loudest anthems! Expect Biffy Clyro, Linkin Park, Blink 182, Evanescence, Fall Out Boy & loads more!

programme.title: Teenage Kicks: The Misfit Years
programme.desc: From angsty misfit anthems & teen rebellion, to non-conformers & pure emotional turbulence, these songs reminded us growing up that sometimes it's totally fine to feel different!

programme.title: Alex Baker's 50 Rock Party Bangers
programme.desc: Alex Baker brings you the best, most sing-a-longable, rock party bangers of all time. If you love Green Day, The Foo Fighters, Bon Jovi and BMTH, then you are in for a treat!

programme.title: All Killer: Stateside Anthems!
programme.desc: In order, 20 of the biggest american anthems from the 21st Century featuring The Killers, Bon Jovi, Nickleback and One Republic.

programme.title: Carol's Carols! A Rockin Good Xmas
programme.desc: T'Pau's "Carols" Decker with 50 years of rockin' seasonal classics - a festive selection box that will leave you wishing it really WAS Christmas every day!

programme.title: 80s School Disco Top 50
programme.desc: Slap on some tight denim, fake tan, designer stubble and leather jackets - and that's just for the girls! This is how we partied in the disco-bopping 80s!

programme.title: Timmy Mallett's Brilliant 80s!
programme.desc: Loud shirts, foam mallet & 25 huge videos of the decade are ready to go as Timmy Mallett brings his Utterly Brilliant party to NOW 80s!

programme.title: Your Festive Party Channel!
programme.desc: This is the soundtrack to your Christmas festivities - 80s style! Only the big party & singalong tunes back to back!

programme.title: Did They Think They Could Dance?!
programme.desc: From 1980 to 1989, videos full of self belief - but have their moves stood the test of time? You decide as we bring you 30 clips of dodgy dance and suspect swaying from the 80s!

programme.title: Awww! Cute Animals in Music Vids
programme.desc: Some of our favourite creatures featured in 80s pop videos. Some are cute, some not so! Spot the camels, horses, elephants, owl, donkeys... and cats!

programme.title: Your Festive Party Channel!
programme.desc: This is the soundtrack to your Christmas festivities - 80s style! Only the big party & singalong tunes back to back!

programme.title: 101 Feelgood Anthems of the 80s!
programme.desc: Robin Banks with a mammoth singalong session of 80s anthems guaranteed to put you in the mood. From Belinda & Bananarama to Whitney & Wham - a full-on decade of top tunes!

programme.title: Your Festive Party Channel!
programme.desc: This is the soundtrack to your Christmas festivities - 80s style! Only the big party & singalong tunes back to back!

programme.title: Christmas Crackers! 1980-1989
programme.desc: All the decade's seasonal songs back to back in order!

programme.title: Your Festive Party Channel!
programme.desc: This is the soundtrack to your Christmas festivities - 80s style! Only the big party & singalong tunes back to back!

programme.title: The UK's Most Streamed Xmas Songs!
programme.desc: Forget about historical sales - this is the chart that really matters today - Mark Goodier with the most streamed Xmas songs in the last decade, many of them over a billion times!

programme.title: Soft Rock & Power Pop!
programme.desc: From the decade that invented the genre - non-stop powerful love songs, back to back.

programme.title: Blimey! Wasn't It Bigger? 1980-89
programme.desc: Every one of these brilliant songs is a true 80s gem. Amazingly though, none of them ever made the UK Top 10. Great tunes from big names including Abba, INXS, Bon Jovi and more!

programme.title: Cuddle On The Couch - The Love 50
programme.desc: 4 hours of 80s love. What more could you ask for a long smooch on the sofa?

programme.title: The Greatest Showmen! Top 25
programme.desc: Counting down the decade's greatest frontmen in rock and pop, with some of the most memorable tracks of the 80s. Big hair, big lips, big egos, big voices, and big anthems galore!

programme.title: Sunday Love Songs!
programme.desc: From the decade that invented the power ballad - non-stop love songs, back to back.

programme.title: 40 One-Hit Wonders with Pat Sharp
programme.desc: They all had 1 defining chart smash - then never darkened our top 20 again! Our One-Hit stars include Judy Boucher, The Vapors, Matthew Wilder & Midnight Oil.

programme.title: Hits That Missed!
programme.desc: Lesser known songs you may have forgotten from artists you'll certainly know!

programme.title: Less-Heard-Hits from A-List Stars!
programme.desc: They were all multiple hit makers in the 80s - but some songs are heard more than most. Here's some you might have forgotten, including Madonna, Kate Bush & Elton John.

programme.title: Duncan James' Eurovision Top 25
programme.desc: His band Blue represented the UK in 2011 - coming 11th! But there have been far bigger winners & losers over 50 years as we go Eurovision crazy with 2 hours of highs - and lows!

programme.title: WOW! What A Party!
programme.desc: A non-stop ticket to the ultimate retro rave! We crank up the neon and hit the dancefloor with the most electrifying feelgood music videos the 80s had to offer.

programme.title: Too Funky! Paul Young v G Michael
programme.desc: The funky & soulful side of 2 of the decade's leading men - Paul Young & George Michael. From Careless Whisper to Wherever I Lay My Hat.

programme.title: Blimey! Wasn't It Bigger? 1980-89
programme.desc: Every one of these brilliant songs is a true 80s gem. Amazingly though, none of them ever made the UK Top 10. Great tunes from big names including Abba, INXS, Bon Jovi and more!

programme.title: Paul Young's 25 Classic Covers!
programme.desc: Paul Young, who sung 1 or 2 himself, brings you 25 classic 80s hits that were all covers, including Whitney, Madness, Billy Idol & Simply Red. Some will really surprise you!

programme.title: Soft Rock & Power Pop!
programme.desc: From the decade that invented the genre - non-stop powerful love songs, back to back.

programme.title: Complete George Michael: 1982-1989
programme.desc: A complete video retrospective of George's 80s hits - both solo & with Wham, Elton John, Aretha Franklin & that forgotten top 10 from Boogie Box High.

programme.title: Every Video- Queen's Greatest Hits
programme.desc: In order - 16 videos from the biggest selling album from the 80s - Queen's Greatest Hits! From Killer Queen to Flash.

programme.title: 80s Rock Anthems Night!
programme.desc: Non-stop 80s rock & power ballads - all night! From Queen, Bon Jovi & Whitesnake to Meat Loaf, Bonnie Tyler & Tina Turner.

programme.title: Paul Young's 25 Classic Covers!
programme.desc: Paul Young, who sung 1 or 2 himself, brings you 25 classic 80s hits that were all covers, including Whitney, Madness, Billy Idol & Simply Red. Some will really surprise you!

programme.title: The NOW 100 of the 70s
programme.desc: Exclusive to NOW 70s, Mark Goodier brings this marathon 100 countdown of the decade's biggest acts, based on global record sales, live concert takings, and awards. So who's no.1?

programme.title: Boogie Nights!
programme.desc: If you don't get up and dance, you aren't human! Disco was the best floor show in town & once again it's time to get up & get lost in the pulse!

programme.title: Around The World! 1970-1979
programme.desc: From the Top Of The World to Argentina, via Bangor, Babylon, Barbados, Cuba, Copacabana & Hong Kong - this is our wander round the world in song titles!

programme.title: Pat Sharp's Stage & Silver Screen!
programme.desc: 25 singalongs made famous in the theatre, on TV & at the movies. Expect The Partridge Family, Evita & Watership Down, plus a good dollop of Bond, Grease & Saturday Night Fever!

programme.title: 1970 Unleashed!
programme.desc: Classic hits from just 1 year - 1970!

programme.title: Every Number 2 of 1970
programme.desc: Runners-up from the UK charts in 1970 - those 10 songs that didn't quite make it, including Elvis Presley, Canned Heat, Mary Hopkin, The Kinks & Deep Purple.

programme.title: 1970 Unleashed!
programme.desc: Classic hits from just 1 year - 1970!

programme.title: Christmas No.1s 1970-1979
programme.desc: Re-live the seasonal chart toppers through the decade. Including old favourites Slade, Mud & Boney M plus some surprises from Pink Floyd, Jimmy Osmond & Benny Hill!

programme.title: As Noddy Says.. It's Christmaaas!
programme.desc: Feelgood hits & festive favourites from just 1 decade - the 1970s! Santa hat, platform boots & tinsel at the ready?

programme.title: Christmas Party Anthems! Top 20
programme.desc: 20 sing out loud classics from the 50s, 60s & 70s to get you in the festive spirit. You can thank us later.

programme.title: Simply Having A Wonderful Xmas!
programme.desc: Feelgood hits & festive favourites from just 1 decade - the 1970s! Santa hat, platform boots & tinsel at the ready?

programme.title: 60s v 70s Christmas!
programme.desc: 60 minutes of Christmas classics - 1 from the 60s followed by another from the 70s. Simple!

programme.title: Pete Waterman's Xmas in the 70s
programme.desc: From John & Yoko's 1972 anthem, right through to Abba's classic performance in front of a giant snowman! These are the biggest Christmas Hits of the 70s.

programme.title: NOW 100 Hits: Love Songs!
programme.desc: Simon Bates with the ultimate countdown of 70s love songs. 100 songs with heartfelt vocals, lush strings & big breakdowns in an 8 hour marathon! Expect Chicago, Eric Carmen & 10cc.

programme.title: Tony Blackburn's Pop Party! 70-75
programme.desc: Blackburn's your man for the ultimate early 70s party playlist. How about some pure pop cheese from big names & forgotten acts that'll have you singing your head off? Let's bop!

programme.title: Saturday Night's Alright!
programme.desc: From the era of Glam Rock, New Wave & Disco - it's all the party hits from just 1 decade - the 1970s! Platform boots & flares at the ready?

programme.title: Pat Sharp's 25 Silly Songs!
programme.desc: 2 hours of funny videos, silly songs & novelty hits - all of them amazing and all in the best possible taste!

programme.title: 25 Forgotten Favourites!
programme.desc: 25 videos you'd probably forgotten, some of which you hoped you'd never see again! Standby for Boney M, David Soul, Mary MacGregor, Badfinger & Kate Bush.

programme.title: What The Heck Kept This Off No.1?
programme.desc: Every one of these superb No.2 hits from 1970-1979 is a classic, but what other songs stopped each of them getting to the top? Queen, Ringo, Elton, Boney M and more are all here!

programme.title: Mark Goodier's No.1s of the 70s!
programme.desc: Mark Goodier's 7 hour marathon run through of some of the biggest number 1 videos of the 1970s. From Edison Lighthouse to Pink Floyd via lots of Abba & Rod Stewart!

programme.title: All Day - They Hit The Top Spot!
programme.desc: All day - a choice selection of the 168 singles that reached the top of the UK charts in the 1970s!

programme.title: Rock Number 1s! 1970-1979
programme.desc: An hour of rockin' chart toppers from the 70s.

programme.title: Pat Sharp's Forgotten No.1s
programme.desc: Pat Man selects 30 chart toppers of the 70s that have probably slipped your mind! Expect lesser remembered hits from Mud, Dr Hook, David Cassidy, Lena Martell & Brotherhood of Man.

programme.title: Tony Blackburn's Pop Party! 70-75
programme.desc: Blackburn's your man for the ultimate early 70s party playlist. How about some pure pop cheese from big names & forgotten acts that'll have you singing your head off? Let's bop!

programme.title: Saturday Night's Alright!
programme.desc: From the era of Glam Rock, New Wave & Disco - it's all the party hits from just 1 decade - the 1970s! Platform boots & flares at the ready?

programme.title: All Day - They Hit The Top Spot!
programme.desc: All day - a choice selection of the 168 singles that reached the top of the UK charts in the 1970s!

programme.title: Every Party No.1 of the 70s!
programme.desc: In year order - the 70s biggest party tunes of the 70s! Every one of them a chart topper.

programme.title: Every Party No.1 of the 70s!
programme.desc: In year order - the 70s biggest party tunes of the 70s! Every one of them a chart topper.

programme.title: A is for Apple
programme.desc: Chicken and corn are the key players in this letter “C” challenge. Chef Lauren Gulyas prepares one of her favourite Italian dishes, chicken Marsala. Using garlic, shallots, and white wine, Chef Lauren whips up a rich Marsala sauce that is nutty and floral in flavour. Next, she transforms corn into a creamy polenta topping for her Shepard’s pie...with a twist! Sautéing onion, garlic, and lean ground beef, she uses Worcestershire sauce and tomato paste to give the pie filling an extra flavour boost. Once she finishes those dishes, Chef Lauren creates a mouth-watering recipe that combines both chicken and corn.

programme.title: A is for Apple
programme.desc: Chef Robert Jewell has a challenge on his hands after picking the letter “K.” He decides to use ingredients kaffir lime and kohlrabi. First, Robert re-invents the ordinary shrimp skewer, using lemongrass as the skewer (yes, the skewer!). He brings the flavour to the next level with zesty kaffir lime. Using the leaves of the kaffir lime with fresh herbs, Robert makes a dipping sauce for the skewer. Next, Robert fries up salty peameal bacon in one pan and sautés earthy kohlrabi with leeks, potato, and garlic in another. He brings the ingredients together into a single skillet, adding eggs and baking it into a hearty frittata. For his final dish, Robert uses both kaffir lime and kohlrabi in...

programme.title: A is for Apple
programme.desc: “A” is on the menu and Chef Robert Jewell takes on this meal challenge with apricots and avocados. First up, Robert cooks a spicy roasted quail and drizzles it with some sweet apricot and calvados sauce. Next, is a meal best served cold! Robert slices up sushi-grade tuna and transforms it into a flavourful tartare, brought to life by rich avocado and refreshing lime. On the side, he adds crusty crostini with savoury soy sauce and sesame oil, the perfect complement for this meltin- your-mouth meal. For his final dish, Robert combines apricots and avocados for an unbelievably tasty dish.

programme.title: Xplore Bulgaria
programme.desc: Luxurious hotels, thrilling water parks, inexpensive food and almost 300 days of bright sunny weather make Bulgaria’s biggest seaside resort, Sunny Beach popular for budget beach getaways. Catriona, however, stumbles onto the historic town of Nessebar, which is over 3000 years old, and realizes that there is more to the place than meets the eye. She goes on to visit the Castra Rubra winery, where she finds out about the history of Viticulture in Bulgaria and the process of wine making.

programme.title: City Breaks

programme.title: Food Fact Fun
programme.desc: From exploring a vintage car museum to scaling a 5 meter ice-wall and sampling a rich bread cookie, Watch Alex exploring The Hague, also known as the “International city of peace”.

programme.title: 10 Days Scotland
programme.desc: A modern European oil city built on the back of a rich maritime heritage, Aberdeen is the energetic kingpin of northeast Scotland. While the boom times may come and go, the dynamic coastal metropolis never ceases to thrill with its free museums, outdoor adventures and natural attractions right on the city’s doorstep.

programme.title: Backpack Serbia
programme.desc: Heather explores Požarevac and visits the ancient town of Viminacium. Later visits National Museum, concluding with Majdanpek’s Rajkova Pecina Caves.

programme.title: Boarding Pass
programme.desc: Emeline Nsingi Nkosi goes to Rovaniemi, where she visits a husky farm and finds out about about breeding and raising huskies.

programme.title: Xplore Bulgaria
programme.desc: For the people of Sofia, preserving its heritage is sacrosanct, and this can be seen in the way the city's infrastructure is built around its archeological treasures. Catriona realizes this when she roams around the cobblestone streets of the city. With every monument she visits, she finds herself transported to a different era, right from Perperikon fort, which narrate stories of the Byzantine empire, to Boyana church, which is home to some of the earliest examples of medieval artwork.

programme.title: Great World Hotels
programme.desc: From lazing in hammocks by the beach to sipping drinks on a private yacht, Kim realizes that Maldives is the perfect destination to unwind in style.

programme.title: Food Fact Fun
programme.desc: From trying dishes like Stroopwafel and Palat Stoofvlees to visiting the Erasmus bridge, cube houses and wall painting on the streets, Alex explores Rotterdam.

programme.title: 10 Days Scotland
programme.desc: Since medieval times Aberdeenshire and its northwestern neighbour Moray have been the richest and most fertile regions of the Highlands. Aberdeenshire is famed for its Aberdeen Angus beef cattle, its many fine castles and the prosperous 'granite city' of Aberdeen.

programme.title: Backpack Serbia
programme.desc: Explore Majdanpek with our host as the city brings the viewers closer to the treasures strewn across the Serbian countryside.

programme.title: Boarding Pass
programme.desc: Levi is Finland's largest and fastest-growing ski destination. Emeline is here, to find out the exciting activities that Levi offers, in summer.

programme.title: Xplore Bhutan
programme.desc: With snow-capped peaks rising over primeval forests and traditional villages, Paro is like an Oriental Switzerland. On a visit to Paro, Radhika explores famous monasteries such as the Rinpung Dzong and Takstang Monastery, and learns the history and legends associated with them. Along the way, she finds out the secrets to the quintessential Bhutanese peace and contentment.

programme.title: Great World Hotels
programme.desc: An invigorating spa treatment, a cooking lesson, a snorkeling session – Kim has experiences in the Maldives that leave her completely rejuvenated.

programme.title: Food Fact Fun
programme.desc: From trying Orange zest beer and traditional Dutch dishes to exploring St.Martin's Cathedral, Dom Tower and enjoying go karting and stand up paddle boat ride, watch Alex enjoy his trip in Utrecht.

programme.title: 10 Days Scotland
programme.desc: In the enchanting landscapes of Inverness, Robbie’s journey takes a whimsical turn: from eccentric to downright magical.

programme.title: Backpack Serbia
programme.desc: Heather explores Nis,one of the oldest cities in Europe.She visits a concentration camp and later paraglides to end by watching a musical performance.

programme.title: Boarding Pass
programme.desc: Emeline goes to Ruka-Kuusamo, where she tries river rafting. She also meets a reindeer herder,who tells her about the unique ways of herding reindeer.

programme.title: Xplore Bhutan
programme.desc: Actress and travel enthusiast, Radhika Bangia explores the enigma that is Bhutan, when she visits Thimpu, the capital city with no traffic lights and no skyscrapers invading the skyline. Here, she checks out significant sights such as the Tibetan-style National Memorial Chorten, the National Library and the Folk Heritage Museum in order to understand more about the beliefs, history, architecture and cuisine of Bhutan.

programme.title: World Heritage
programme.desc: Explore the ancient heritage sites of Abu Simbel, the Philae complex of Nubia and the Hatshepsut Temple to unravel the mystical stories behind the ancient temples of Egypt.

programme.title: Food Fact Fun
programme.desc: Alex tries traditional Dutch food in Leiden, learns about Dutch history at Prinsenhof Museum, visits a Gothic church, a local cheese market and Delftware factory at Gouda.

programme.title: 10 Days Scotland
programme.desc: The grand finale of Robbie’s wild homecoming unfolds amidst the rugged beauty of the Isle of Skye.

programme.title: Backpack Serbia
programme.desc: Continue exploring Serbia with Heather as she visits the Manasija monastery, Resavska caves, ending with a joyride onboard Eight of Sargan rail line.

programme.title: With Love From Mauritius
programme.desc: Krisann and Nathan’s vacation in Mauritius begins in Le Morne, where an unexpected adventure awaits the latter.

programme.title: Xplore Bhutan
programme.desc: Known as Druk Yul or the “Land of the Thunder Dragon”, Bhutan is the country of mountains, monasteries and mystery. Radhika Bangia finds this to be true when she visits Punakha, the former capital of Bhutan, where she marvels at the architecture of Punakha Dzong and gets to know the story behind the two rivers, Mo Chhu and Po Chhu. She also explores the sacred temples and Mebar Tsho lake of Bumthang, the religious heart of Bhutan, and gets to know the local legends.

programme.desc: Jamie Srubis tries out spa treatments, which are inspired by the Dead Sea and the desert surroundings at Hotel Kempinski Ishtar in Jordan.

programme.title: 10 Days Scotland
programme.desc: Robbie’s journey to reconnect with his Scottish roots begins in Edinburgh, the stunning capital city perched on extinct volcanoes. Navigating the twists of the Royal Mile, strutting around the majestic Edinburgh castle and learning to sip scotch like a true Scotsman, he feels a tad closer to his heritage. The real fun kicks in, however, when he stumbles onto a rather flamboyant way to unleash his inner Highlander.

programme.title: Xplore Bulgaria
programme.desc: Like Rome, Plovdiv straddles seven hills; but as Europe’s oldest continuously inhabited city, it’s far more ancient. As Catriona takes a tour of the city to see its iconic attractions such as a Roman Amphitheatre, which was once the setting for gladiator fights, and the striking Baroque Saints Constantine and Helena Church, she begins to see how seamlessly modern life blends with the age-old ruins. Along the way, she realizes why Plovdiv is called the ‘Eternal City’ of Bulgaria.

programme.title: Boarding Pass
programme.desc: Emeline Nsingi Nkosi goes to Santa Village at Rovaniemi, where she reads some of the letters that children from around the world write to him.

programme.title: Xplore Bulgaria
programme.desc: Luxurious hotels, thrilling water parks, inexpensive food and almost 300 days of bright sunny weather make Bulgaria’s biggest seaside resort, Sunny Beach popular for budget beach getaways. Catriona, however, stumbles onto the historic town of Nessebar, which is over 3000 years old, and realizes that there is more to the place than meets the eye. She goes on to visit the Castra Rubra winery, where she finds out about the history of Viticulture in Bulgaria and the process of wine making.

programme.title: City Breaks
programme.desc: Benafsha embarks on a whirlwind adventure in Ahmedabad. With just 48 hours in the city, she is determined to make the most of it, but how?

programme.title: Food Fact Fun
programme.desc: From exploring a vintage car museum to scaling a 5 meter ice-wall and sampling a rich bread cookie, Watch Alex exploring The Hague, also known as the “International city of peace”.

programme.title: 10 Days Scotland
programme.desc: A modern European oil city built on the back of a rich maritime heritage, Aberdeen is the energetic kingpin of northeast Scotland. While the boom times may come and go, the dynamic coastal metropolis never ceases to thrill with its free museums, outdoor adventures and natural attractions right on the city’s doorstep.

programme.title: Backpack Serbia
programme.desc: Heather explores Požarevac and visits the ancient town of Viminacium. Later visits National Museum, concluding with Majdanpek’s Rajkova Pecina Caves.

programme.title: Boarding Pass
programme.desc: Emeline Nsingi Nkosi goes to Rovaniemi, where she visits a husky farm and finds out about about breeding and raising huskies.

programme.title: Xplore Bulgaria
programme.desc: For the people of Sofia, preserving its heritage is sacrosanct, and this can be seen in the way the city's infrastructure is built around its archeological treasures. Catriona realizes this when she roams around the cobblestone streets of the city. With every monument she visits, she finds herself transported to a different era, right from Perperikon fort, which narrate stories of the Byzantine empire, to Boyana church, which is home to some of the earliest examples of medieval artwork.

programme.title: Great World Hotels
programme.desc: From lazing in hammocks by the beach to sipping drinks on a private yacht, Kim realizes that Maldives is the perfect destination to unwind in style.

programme.title: Food Fact Fun
programme.desc: From trying dishes like Stroopwafel and Palat Stoofvlees to visiting the Erasmus bridge, cube houses and wall painting on the streets, Alex explores Rotterdam.

programme.title: 10 Days Scotland
programme.desc: Since medieval times Aberdeenshire and its northwestern neighbour Moray have been the richest and most fertile regions of the Highlands. Aberdeenshire is famed for its Aberdeen Angus beef cattle, its many fine castles and the prosperous 'granite city' of Aberdeen.

programme.title: Backpack Serbia
programme.desc: Explore Majdanpek with our host as the city brings the viewers closer to the treasures strewn across the Serbian countryside.

programme.title: Boarding Pass
programme.desc: Levi is Finland's largest and fastest-growing ski destination. Emeline is here, to find out the exciting activities that Levi offers, in summer.

programme.title: Xplore Bhutan
programme.desc: With snow-capped peaks rising over primeval forests and traditional villages, Paro is like an Oriental Switzerland. On a visit to Paro, Radhika explores famous monasteries such as the Rinpung Dzong and Takstang Monastery, and learns the history and legends associated with them. Along the way, she finds out the secrets to the quintessential Bhutanese peace and contentment.

programme.title: Great World Hotels
programme.desc: An invigorating spa treatment, a cooking lesson, a snorkeling session – Kim has experiences in the Maldives that leave her completely rejuvenated.

programme.title: Food Fact Fun
programme.desc: From trying Orange zest beer and traditional Dutch dishes to exploring St.Martin's Cathedral, Dom Tower and enjoying go karting and stand up paddle boat ride, watch Alex enjoy his trip in Utrecht.

programme.title: 10 Days Scotland
programme.desc: In the enchanting landscapes of Inverness, Robbie’s journey takes a whimsical turn: from eccentric to downright magical.

programme.title: Backpack Serbia
programme.desc: Heather explores Nis,one of the oldest cities in Europe.She visits a concentration camp and later paraglides to end by watching a musical performance.

programme.title: Boarding Pass
programme.desc: Emeline goes to Ruka-Kuusamo, where she tries river rafting. She also meets a reindeer herder,who tells her about the unique ways of herding reindeer.

programme.title: Xplore Bhutan
programme.desc: Actress and travel enthusiast, Radhika Bangia explores the enigma that is Bhutan, when she visits Thimpu, the capital city with no traffic lights and no skyscrapers invading the skyline. Here, she checks out significant sights such as the Tibetan-style National Memorial Chorten, the National Library and the Folk Heritage Museum in order to understand more about the beliefs, history, architecture and cuisine of Bhutan.

programme.title: World Heritage
programme.desc: Explore the ancient heritage sites of Abu Simbel, the Philae complex of Nubia and the Hatshepsut Temple to unravel the mystical stories behind the ancient temples of Egypt.
